title: Geometric Brownian Motion
equation_latex: dS_t = mu * S_t * dt + sigma * S_t * dW_t
notes: This is the Geometric Brownian Motion (GBM) SDE for asset prices. dS_t represents the change in asset price

title: GBM Solution
equation_latex: S_t = S_0 * exp((mu - 0.5 * sigma^2) * t + sigma * W_t)
notes: This equation gives the solution to the GBM SDE. S_t represents the asset price at time t

title: Ornstein-Uhlenbeck Process
equation_latex: dX_t = theta * (mu - X_t) * dt + sigma * dW_t
notes: This is the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck (OU) process SDE. dX_t represents the change

title: Mean-Reverting Level
notes: This equation shows that the OU process reverts to its long-term mean mu. As time goes to infinity

title: Ito's Lemma
equation_latex: dY_t = (partial f/partial t + mu * partial f/partial x + 0.5 * sigma^2 * partial^2 f/partial x^2) * dt + sigma * partial f/partial x * dW_t
notes: This is Ito's Lemma for a function f(X_t

title: Ito's Lemma for GBM
equation_latex: d ln(S_t) = (mu - 0.5 * sigma^2) * dt + sigma * dW_t
notes: This is Ito's Lemma applied to ln(S_t) for GBM. d ln(S_t) represents the change in log price

title: Ito's Lemma for f(S_t) = S_t^2
equation_latex: d(S_t^2) = (2 * mu * S_t^2 + sigma^2 * S_t^2) * dt + 2 * sigma * S_t^2 * dW_t
notes: This is Ito's Lemma applied to f(S_t) = S_t^2. The drift term includes both the 2*mu*S_t^2 term from ordinary calculus and the sigma^2*S_t^2 Ito correction. This example shows how Ito's Lemma differs from the ordinary chain rule.

title: Stochastic Integral
notes: This equation defines the Ito stochastic integral. I_t represents the integral of the adapted process X_s with respect to Brownian motion W_s. The stochastic integral is defined as the limit of Riemann sums

title: Ito Isometry
equation_latex: E[(integral_0^t X_s * dW_s)^2] = E[integral_0^t X_s^2 ds]
notes: This equation defines the Ito Isometry property. The expectation of the squared stochastic integral equals the expectation of the integral of the squared integrand. Ito Isometry is crucial for calculating variances of stochastic integrals.

title: Martingale Property
notes: This equation shows that the stochastic integral is a martingale. The conditional expectation of the future integral given information at time t is zero. The martingale property is fundamental to risk-neutral valuation in finance.

title: Ito Product Rule
equation_latex: d(X_t * Y_t) = X_t * dY_t + Y_t * dX_t + d[X

title: Girsanov Theorem (Change of Measure)
notes: This equation defines the Girsanov transformation for changing probability measures. dW_t^Q represents Brownian motion under the new measure Q

title: Market Price of Risk
notes: This equation defines the market price of risk. lambda_t represents the Sharpe ratio of the asset

title: Risk-Neutral Dynamics
equation_latex: dS_t = r_t * S_t * dt + sigma_t * S_t * dW_t^Q
notes: This equation gives the risk-neutral dynamics of an asset price. Under the risk-neutral measure Q

title: Radon-Nikodym Derivative
equation_latex: Z_T = exp(-integral_0^T lambda_s * dW_s^P - 0.5 * integral_0^T lambda_s^2 ds)
notes: This equation defines the Radon-Nikodym derivative for changing from measure P to Q. Z_T represents the likelihood ratio

title: Kolmogorov Forward Equation
equation_latex: partial p / partial t = -partial (mu * p) / partial x + 0.5 * partial^2 (sigma^2 * p) / partial x^2
notes: This equation defines the Kolmogorov forward (Fokker-Planck) equation for the transition density p(x

title: Kolmogorov Backward Equation
equation_latex: partial p / partial t = mu * partial p / partial x + 0.5 * sigma^2 * partial^2 p / partial x^2
notes: This equation defines the Kolmogorov backward equation. Unlike the forward equation

title: Multi-Dimensional Ito's Lemma
equation_latex: dY_t = (partial f/partial t + nabla f * mu + 0.5 * tr(Sigma * Sigma^T * Hessian f)) * dt + (nabla f * Sigma) * dW_t
notes: This is Ito's Lemma for multi-dimensional processes. nabla f is the gradient

title: Optional Stopping Theorem
equation_latex: E[X_tau] = E[X_0] for bounded stopping times tau
notes: This theorem states that for a martingale X_t

title: Local Martingale
equation_latex: Integral_0^t H_s * dM_s is a local martingale
notes: This equation defines a local martingale. A local martingale is a process that becomes a martingale when stopped at an increasing sequence of stopping times. Local martingales are more general than martingales and appear in many financial models.

title: Semimartingale
notes: This equation defines a semimartingale as the sum of a local martingale M_t and a finite variation process A_t. Semimartingales are the most general class of processes for which stochastic integration can be defined. Most financial models are semimartingales.

title: Predictable Representation
equation_latex: Any square-integrable martingale can be represented as a stochastic integral
